715352f-b.title: Manhattan: 125th Street - 2nd Avenue
715352f-b.text:
(1)
East 125th Street, east from, but not including Second Ave., to
the Harlem River. Buildings shown (across clearance for the Manhattn
Approach to the Triborough Bridge), face onto East 124th Stroet.
September 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A further view west, to and including Second Ave.
September 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, but viewed in the opposite direction (from East 124th
Street, northward). The rears of houses, therefore, appearing in the
background are Nos. 302 to 330 (left to right) East 126th Street, south
side. The cleared area seen in the three views now (1937) constitute
the approach to the Triborough Bridge.
Sertember 19, 1934.
. Sperr.  i6 kcrRbDUCrIoNs.

707976f-b.text:

Studio on East 126th Street.
September 19, 1934.

715353f-c.text:

715354f-a.title: Manhattan: 125th Street - 2nd Avenue
715354f-a.text:
304-302 East 125th Street, adjoining and east of the S.E. corner
of Second Avenue. These two buildings, along with the entire block,
will be demolished by 1934, to make way for the approach to the
Tri-Borough Bridge.
April 12, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

715360f-b.title: Manhattan: 125th Street - 2nd Avenue
715360f-b.text:
(1)
125th Street, from but not including, Second Ave., to and includ-
ing Third Ave. The small white 3-story building in the right fore-
ground, All Saints' Chapel (R.C.), is a frame structure with a stucco
front. Next to it is Public School No. 39 B.
August 2, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, five years later.
April 12, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
